PATIENT_ID: TEST_TBI_002
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-20 18:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-20 18:15:00
Patient arrived via ambulance following fall from height.
Suspected traumatic brain injury observed.
Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) assessed on arrival: 10 (E3 V3 M4).
Patient hypotensive with BP 85/50, tachycardic with HR 120.
GCS reassessed during initial Emergency Department evaluation prior to adequate resuscitation.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-20 18:45:00
Resuscitation initiated with 2L crystalloid bolus.
Blood pressure improved to 110/70, heart rate decreased to 95.
Patient adequately resuscitated after fluid bolus.
Note: GCS was already documented on arrival before resuscitation was completed.
Documentation confirming GCS was assessed BEFORE adequate cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
Location and timing of GCS assessment: Emergency Department, pre-resuscitation.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-20 19:15:00
CT BRAIN WITHOUT CONTRAST

FINDINGS:
Left temporal contusion with surrounding edema. No skull fracture.

IMPRESSION:
Traumatic brain injury with left temporal contusion.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-20 19:45:00
CT confirms TBI. Patient GCS remains 10.
Will admit to ICU for neuro monitoring.
